head.note: This manuscript contains: Extracts from several writers. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 8 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Extracts from several writers

msItem.author: John the monk
msItem.title: John the monk, on Love
msItem.incipit: ܐܘܡܢ ܗܘ ܓܝܪ. ܚܒ̈ܝܒܝܢ. ܒܥܠܕܪܢ. ܘܨܢܝܥ ܕܠܩܘܼܒܠܢ ܘܡܬܟܲܬܫ. ܏ܘܫ..

msItem.author: Thomas
msItem.title: Extracts from Thomas

msItem.author: Thomas
msItem.title: Part a
msItem.incipit: ܠܐ ܡܫ̣ܟܚ ܕܒܥܢܝ̣ܢܐ ܕܠܐܗ ܢܗܘ̣ܐ ܘܕܒܢ̈ܝܢܫܐ̣. ܘܠܐ ܟܕ ܩܲܪܝܒ ܐܢܫ ܠܓܢ̣ܣܗ ܦܓܪܢܝܐ̣. ܢܬܩܲܪܒ ܠܪ̈ܘܚܢܝܬܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Thomas
msItem.title: Part b
msItem.incipit: ܫ̇ܡܥܬ ܠܣ̇ܬܘܪ̈ܐ ܘܟ̇ܐܝܬ ܒܗܘܢ܆ ܘܗܕܐ ܡܦܲܢܝܢ ܗܘܘ ܠܝ ܦܥ̈ܠܐ ܕܒܝܫ̣ܘܬܐ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Basil
msItem.title: Extract from Basil
msItem.incipit: ܙܕܩ̇ ܠܗ ܠܕܝܪܝܐ ܕܢܗ̣ܘܐ ܐܝܬ ܠܗ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܘܒܪ̈ܐ ܡܣܲܪ̈ܩܐ

msItem.author: Abraham Nephtarenus
msItem.title: Extract from Abraham Nephtarenus
msItem.incipit: ܡܛܠ ܕܚ̣ܙܝܬܟ ܕܨ̇ܒܐ ܐܢܬ ܠܡܐܙ̇ܠ ܠܚܝ̈ܐ. ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 464, no 1.

msItem.author: Xystus
msItem.title: Extract from Xystus

msItem.title: Part of a homily

physDesc.p: Two paper leaves, much mutilated, written in a good, regular hand of the xiith or xiiith cent., and containing part of a homily.

item.p: Two paper leaves, much mutilated.

handNote.desc: The leaves are written in a good, regular hand of the xiith or xiiith cent.

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Part of a discourse on the Fatherhood of God and the Incarnation of the Son. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Part of a discourse on the Fatherhood of God and the Incarnation of the Son

physDesc.p: Four paper leaves, about 7 in. by 5 3/8, much stained and torn. There are 22 or 23 lines in each stage.

item.p: Four paper leaves, about 7 in. by 5 3/8, much stained and torn. There are 22 or 23 lines in each stage.

handNote.desc: They are written in a good, Nestorian hand of the xiith cent., with occasional vowel points.

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Portions of metrical discourses of Jacob of Batnae

physDesc.p: Two paper leaves, both much mutilated, written in double columns, in good, regular hands of about the xith cent.

item.p: It consists of two paper leaves, both much mutilated, written in double columns.

handNote.desc: It was written in good, regular hands of about the xith cent.

item.p: On the verso of the second leaf, there is part of a note, signed by one Benjamin bar Gūryā of Amid

head.note: This manuscript contains: Histories of holy men. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Histories of holy men

physDesc.p: Part of the last leaf of a paper manuscript.

item.p: It is part of the last leaf of a paper manuscript.

On the recto there is a note, stating that the volume was read by a monk named John, from the convent of Mar Simeon at Kartamin . He entered the convent of S. Mary Deipara, in the year 1721, A.D. 1413, at which time there was only one monk there.

p.quote: ܦܓ̇ܥܬ ܒܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܬܫܥ̈ܝܬܐ ܕܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ ܐܢܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܡܕܒܪܝܐ ܡܢ ܥܘܡܪܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܡܪܝ ܫܡܥܘܢ ܕܩܪܬܡܝܢ܀ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܠܝܘܬܪܢܐ. ܨ̇ܠܐ ܒܦܘܪܫܢܐ. ܥܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܣܟܝܢܐ ܕܬܒ̣ܥ ܫܘܒܩܢܐ. ܕܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܐܒܬܢܐ. ܣܢܝ̣ܩ ܥܠ ܚܘܠܡܢܐ. ܘܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܡܘܡ̣ܬܢܐ ܘܚ̇ܐܪ ܠܥܘܕܪܢܐ. ܏ܘܫ܀ ܘܐܢ̇ܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܥܠܬ ܠܕܝܪܐ ܗܕܐ ܒܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ ܘܫܒ̈ܥܡܐ ܘܐܪ̈ܒܥ ܘܥܣܪ̈ܝܢ ܕܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ ܘܠܐ ܐܫܟܚܬ ܒܕܝܪܐ ܗܕܐ ܐܠܐ ܚܕ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܒܠܚܘܕܘܗܝ ܪܒܢ ܡܘܫܐ ܡܢ ܚܣܢܐ ܕܟܐܦܐ ܐܠܗܐ ܢܚܲܣܐ ܠܗ ܐܡܝܢ.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Unvocalized Syriac of any variety or period
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized West Syriac Script
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized East Syriac Script
